TopicTitle: Where has this game been all of my life?!

Articles.Content:
So I was introduced to KSP from my pal Shamus Young over at TwentySided

I got the Demo and bought it after doing only the tutorial missions, and I have not been disappointed. Current era space sim? Yes, please! Now my brain is brimming with all of the cool stuff that I want to go into the game. So here I am signed up on the forums so I can get up to speed. I am so glad this game is still being developed.

*Dives in*

Thanks for making a game you love! (That is a rarer today than it used to be and I love to support these kind of developers)

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Your friend...is...so...awesome...

Edited April 23, 2013 by BigBoy734

UPDATE: My First "Mission"

As I mentioned above, I played around with the tutorial, and shot a few rockets, but I wanted to give myself a set goal as a mission. Something simple, but interesting and challenging.

I decided to try and achieve a full manned orbit with the simplest, and most efficient rocket possible, while still recovering my Kerbonaut safely.

SUCCESS!

It took many tries, but finally I used only a small 2 stage rocket (plus Command Module) to get Jebediah around the planet one full orbit, and recovered him safely, splashing down in the sea east of [Africa-looking-Continent].*

The rocket I used:

First Stage:

LV-T800 tank with FL-T30 liquid-fueled rocket motor

Second Stage:

LV-T400 tank with LV-909 motor

Jebediah takes a swim while awaiting rescue.

Just my simple little mission, but I really had fun with it, and wanted to share my first experience

*Is the planet based on Pangaea?

Edited April 23, 2013 by Oleyo

Your images are broken, so you might want to right click on your image and choose the option "Copy image URL" instead of using the webpage address. Also, since I see that you are using Google Drive for your images, you might want to make a document and save the images in there instead. I find that my images don't break when I do that.

Good luck with your future missions!
I couldn't agree more. Welcome and congratulations! The beginning of the game is most fun because you build CRAZY rocket designs!!!

You only build the crazy designs at the beginning? I still do!

I couldn't agree more, Oleyo, in fact I was just telling my best friend something similar - this game is such a simple idea I can't believe it hasn't been done before. I didn't even bother with the demo, personally, as soon as I saw the game it was an instant purchase for me. Steam tells me I have over 120 hours in it...in about 2 weeks...

Thanks for the heads up. I fixed the Image.

Also, I keep trying to get an orbit out of an even smaller second stage consisting of the "200" tank, but it just won't get there. I even fused the second stage directly to the command module to shave off the (tiny) weight of the stack decoupler. I only got half way around the globe, and let me tell you, I do not think Jeb liked that landing. He lived, but it was hard.

Dang, this game is awesome.
